history.proof: intros X Y f T1 T2. apply Extensionality_Ensembles. split. - intros x H. sauto depth: 3. - intros x H. destruct H as [H1 H2]. qsimpl time: 1.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (T1 T2 : Ensemble Y), inverse_image f (Intersection T1 T2) = Intersection (inverse_image f T1) (inverse_image f T2)

Premises:
Ensemble = fun U : Type => U -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Ensemble _%type_scope
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF
inverse_image = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (T : Ensemble Y) => [x : X | In T (f x)] : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Ensemble Y -> Ensemble X Arguments inverse_image {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive Intersection (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) : Ensemble U := Intersection_intro : forall x : U, In B x -> In C x -> In (Intersection B C) x Arguments Intersection {U}%type_scope Arguments Intersection_intro _%type_scope
inverse_image_increasing : forall (f : ?X -> ?Y) (T1 T2 : Ensemble ?Y), Included T1 T2 -> Included (inverse_image f T1) (inverse_image f T2) where ?X : [ |- Type] ?Y : [ |- Type]
inverse_image_empty : forall f : ?X -> ?Y, inverse_image f Empty_set = Empty_set where ?X : [ |- Type] ?Y : [ |- Type]
inverse_image_full : forall f : ?X -> ?Y, inverse_image f Full_set = Full_set where ?X : [ |- Type] ?Y : [ |- Type]
not_injective_elim : forall (U V : Type) (f : U -> V), ~ injective f -> exists x y : U, f x = f y /\ x <> y
Im_ind : forall (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (P : V -> Prop), (forall x : U, In X x -> forall y : V, y = f x -> P y) -> forall v : V, Im U V X f v -> P v
Im_sind : forall (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (P : V -> SProp), (forall x : U, In X x -> forall y : V, y = f x -> P y) -> forall v : V, Im U V X f v -> P v
Im_add : forall (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (x : U) (f : U -> V), Im U V (Add X x) f = Add (Im U V X f) (f x)
Im_intro : forall (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (x : U), In X x -> forall y : V, y = f x -> In (Im U V X f) y
image_empty : forall (U V : Type) (f : U -> V), Im U V Empty_set f = Empty_set
injective = fun (U V : Type) (f : U -> V) => forall x y : U, f x = f y -> x = y : forall U V : Type, (U -> V) -> Prop Arguments injective {U V}%type_scope _%function_scope
Im_inv : forall (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (y : V), In (Im U V X f) y -> exists x : U, In X x /\ f x = y
Union_preserves_Finite : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U), Finite U X -> Finite U Y -> Finite U (Union X Y)
In_Image_elim : forall (U V : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V), injective f -> forall x : U, In (Im U V A f) (f x) -> In A x
Pigeonhole_principle : forall (U V : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (n : nat), cardinal U A n -> forall n' : nat, cardinal V (Im U V A f) n' -> n' < n -> exists x y : U, f x = f y /\ x <> y
Inductive Im (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) : Ensemble V := Im_intro : forall x : U, In X x -> forall y : V, y = f x -> In (Im U V X f) y Arguments Im (_ _)%type_scope _ _%function_scope Arguments Im_intro (_ _)%type_scope _ _%function_scope
injective_preserves_cardinal : forall (U V : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (n : nat), injective f -> cardinal U A n -> forall n' : nat, cardinal V (Im U V A f) n' -> n' = n
G_aux : forall (U : Type) (P : Ensemble U -> Prop), (forall X : Ensemble U, Finite U X -> (forall Y : Ensemble U, Strict_Included Y X -> P Y) -> P X) -> P Empty_set
Included_Strict_Included : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U), Included X Y -> Strict_Included X Y \/ X = Y
Generalized_induction_on_finite_sets : forall (U : Type) (P : Ensemble U -> Prop), (forall X : Ensemble U, Finite U X -> (forall Y : Ensemble U, Strict_Included Y X -> P Y) -> P X) -> forall X : Ensemble U, Finite U X -> P X
Pigeonhole : forall (U V : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (n : nat), cardinal U A n -> forall n' : nat, cardinal V (Im U V A f) n' -> n' < n -> ~ injective f
Strict_super_set_contains_new_element : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U), Included X Y -> X <> Y -> Inhabited (Setminus Y X)
Strict_Included_intro : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U), Included X Y /\ X <> Y -> Strict_Included X Y
Inhabited_Setminus : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U), Included X Y -> ~ Included Y X -> Inhabited (Setminus Y X)
cardinal_is_functional : forall (U : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (c1 : nat), cardinal U X c1 -> forall (Y : Ensemble U) (c2 : nat), cardinal U Y c2 -> X = Y -> c1 = c2
Strict_Included_inv : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U), Strict_Included X Y -> Included X Y /\ Inhabited (Setminus Y X)
incl_soustr : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U) (x : U), Included X Y -> Included (Subtract X x) (Subtract Y x)
incl_st_add_soustr : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U) (x : U), ~ In X x -> Strict_Included (Add X x) Y -> Strict_Included X (Subtract Y x)
incl_card_le : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U) (n m : nat), cardinal U X n -> cardinal U Y m -> Included X Y -> n <= m
incl_st_card_lt : forall (U : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (c1 : nat), cardinal U X c1 -> forall (Y : Ensemble U) (c2 : nat), cardinal U Y c2 -> Strict_Included X Y -> c2 > c1
Distributivity : forall (U : Type) (A B C : Ensemble U), Intersection A (Union B C) = Union (Intersection A B) (Intersection A C)

```coq
intros X Y f T1 T2.
apply Extensionality_Ensembles.
split.
- intros x H.
  inversion H as [x0 H1 H2 H3].
  split.
  + exists x0. split; assumption.
  + exists x0. split; assumption.
- intros x H.
  destruct H as [H1 H2].
  destruct H1 as [x0 [H1 H3]].
  destruct H2 as [x1 [H2 H4]].
  rewrite <- H3 in H4.
  apply (f_equal f) in H4.
  subst x1.
  exists x0.
  split; assumption.
Qed.
```

original: intros X Y f T1 T2. apply Extensionality_Ensembles. split. - intros x H. inversion H as [x0 H1 H2 H3]. split. + exists x0. split; auto. + exists x0. split; auto. - intros x H. destruct H as [H1 H2]. destruct H1 as [x0 [H1 H3]]. destruct H2 as [x1 [H2 H4]]. rewrite <- H3 in H4. apply (f_equal f) in H4. subst x1. exists x0. split; auto.
